answers.text:
Hello Gwendolyn,
While I can’t provide you with the specific answers, I can point you to the “On Other Sites” tab of the “Blog Section” of the ICMA website:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/directory
Here, local government professionals regularly blog about their experiences and challenges in the world of city/county management.   
I also found a recent question from an ICMA member about public officials using digital media. He links to some interesting survey results on the subject: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/22068/The_Internet_and_You
The “Topics” tab will take you to a list of topics that you might find interesting:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics
Any of these will lead you to an entire section of the website dedicated to just that topic, and within that topic you can find related blog posts.  I hope this helps!
Gabriel Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Gwendolyn Harvey
text:
Is any Manager or Asssistant "blogging" on their itranet or internet (my main question) about public management issues - actions, philosophies, leadership, recommended raeading, work/life convergence, and more?
When did you start? Does it have a name? Is it linked from your ICMA profile? How often do you update?  How do you quanitify/assess the readership? If you started, then dropped, how come? If you're thinking about it, but haven't started it, how come? Are your peers finding time to read it? 
Yes, I've asked many questions. As time allows, please tell me your thoughts, interests, and inclinations.
Gwen Harvey, ACM 
Orange County, NC
title: Assistant County Manager
